page.title: 09Tourism
page.content: A good tourist trade gives many local people a good living. The weather is, on the whole, dry and sunny with a fresh wind off the sea. The beaches at Roome Bay and the harbour are populaar with parents and children. Several golf courses are within easy reach. There is a great deal to interest students of history. Booklets can be had at the new Information Office, or a close study of the museum can yield much. Two caravan sites and several hotels cater for visitors . Local people take summer visitors and there are also houses to let. Special entertainment during August, includes a Fair, and lunch time music in the church.
